{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.15980v1", "title": "Construction of Butson matrices using Fourier matrices as input", "summary": "Butson matrices are square orthogonal matrices, denoted by $BH(m,n)$, whose
entries are the complex $m$th roots of unity and satisfy the condition\\
$BH(m,n)\cdot{BH(m,n)}^*=nI_n$, where ${BH(m,n)}^*$ is the conjugate transpose
of $BH(m,n)$ and $I_n$ is the identity matrix. In this work, we propose
constructions for $BH(m,(n-1)n)$ then $BH(m,(\frac{n}{2}-1)n)$, when $n$ and
$m$ are even numbers, using the existing $BH(m,n)$. For each case, we provide
two construction methods: one uses a single input Butson matrix, and another
uses two input Butson matrices. Moreover, we present some results about the
construction of Hadamard matrices.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-04-22T15:32:05Z"}
